properties.title: Alnwick Road 安域道
properties.description: Named after Alnwick, a town in Northumberland in England.

properties.title: Amalfi Drive 津堤徑
properties.description: Named after Amalfi, a town in Italy. Part of the Discovery Bay development.

properties.title: Amoy Street 廈門街
properties.description: Named after Xiamen, a port city in Fujian, China. In the 19th century, Wan Chai was a key hub for sea trade and business. Trading companies established offices, docks, and warehouses along the coast. A British merchant firm, named their docks after Chinese ports: Xiamen and Shantou. These docks later moved inland and were renamed Amoy Street and Swatow Street. These were among Hong Kong's first streets named after Mainland Chinese cities.

properties.title: Angel Island Avenue 安島徑
properties.description: Named after Angel Island, an island in San Francisco Bay, USA. Part of the Royal Palms development.

properties.title: Broadway 百老匯街
properties.description: Named after Broadway, a street in New York City, USA, this street is located in Mei Foo Sun Chuen, the first large-scale private housing estate in Hong Kong. It was built on the site of a former Mobil petroleum storage facility, and pays homage to the company's New York origins.

properties.title: Burma Lines
properties.description: Named after the Burma campaign during WWII.

properties.description: Named after Chengdu, Sichuan province's capital. After the Tai Shing Paper Mill closed, the building was converted into residential units in the 1940s. The nearby streets were named after provinces and cities in China, taking inspiration from the idiom "洛陽紙貴" (Luoyang paper is expensive). Luoyang is an industrial city located in central China's Henan province.

properties.description: Humbert Street exists in both New York and New Jersey but it doesn't seem to have any particular importance. The source of the name is still unknown. This street is located in the Mei Foo Sun Chuen complex.

properties.description: Named after Santa Clara, a city in California, USA. Part of the Royal Palms development.

properties.title: Santa Maria Avenue 瑪利亞徑
properties.description: Named after Santa Maria, a city in California, USA. Part of the Royal Palms development.

properties.title: Santa Monica Avenue 蒙尼卡徑
properties.description: Named after Santa Monica, a city in California, USA. Part of the Royal Palms development.

properties.title: Selkirk Road 西谷道
properties.description: Named after Selkirk, a town in Scotland.

properties.title: Shamchun Street 深圳街
properties.description: Named after Shenzhen, a city in Guangdong, China.

properties.title: Shanghai Street 上海街
properties.description: Named after Shanghai, a city in China. Renamed from 'Station Street' in 1909.

properties.title: Shansi Street 山西街
properties.description: Named after Shanxi, a province in China.

properties.title: Shantung Street 山東街
properties.description: Named after Shandong, a province in China. Renamed from 'Nullah Lane' in 1909.

properties.title: Shek Lung Street 石龍街
properties.description: Named after Shilong, a town in Dongguan, China.

properties.title: Shek Sheung River 石上河
properties.description: Named after River Beas, a river in India.

properties.title: Sheung Yue River 雙魚河
properties.description: Named after River Sutlej, a river in Asia.

properties.title: Shing Mun Redoubt 城門棱堡
properties.description: The Shing Mun Redoubt is a historic military fortification from the 1930s that protected Hong Kong from land-based attacks. It was an important defense during World War II, but the Japanese overtook it in December 1941. The entrances, passages, and exits are named after streets in Central London, like "Oxford Street" and "Piccadilly", which are inscribed over them.

properties.title: Shropshire Road 史樂信路
properties.description: Named after Shropshire, a county in England.

properties.title: Siena Avenue 海澄湖畔路
properties.description: Named after Siena, a city in Italy. Part of the Discovery Bay development.

properties.title: Siena One Drive 海澄徑一段
properties.description: Named after Siena, a city in Italy. Part of the Discovery Bay development.

properties.title: Siena Two Drive 海澄徑二段
properties.description: Named after Siena, a city in Italy. Part of the Discovery Bay development.

properties.title: Smithfield 士美菲路
properties.description: Named after Smithfield, a former meat and poultry market in London. The street is located next to the former site of a cattle depot and a slaughterhouse in Kennedy Town.

properties.title: Snowdon
properties.description: Named after Snowdon or Yr Wyddfa, the highest mountain in Wales.

properties.title: Somerset Path 森麻實徑
properties.description: Named after Somerset, a county in England. Part of the The Royal Oaks development.

properties.title: Somerset Road 森麻實道
properties.description: Named after Somerset, a county in England.

properties.title: South Downs
properties.description: Named after South Downs, a range of chalk hills in the south-eastern coastal counties of England.

properties.title: Stafford Road 施他佛道
properties.description: Named after Stafford, a town in England.

properties.title: Staffordshire Avenue 士達福信路
properties.description: Named after Staffordshire, a county in England.

properties.title: Stirling Road 士他令道
properties.description: Named after Stirling, a city in Scotland.

properties.title: Suffolk Road 沙福道
properties.description: Named after Suffolk, a county in England.

properties.title: Sunning Road 新寧道
properties.description: Named after Taishan, one of the four counties in Guangdong. Lee Hysan, a businessman from Guangdong, developed Causeway Bay in the 1930s and named the streets in the area after his ancestral home in Guangdong.

properties.title: Sun Wui Road 新會道
properties.description: Named after Xinhui, one of the four counties in Guangdong. Lee Hysan, a businessman from Guangdong, developed Causeway Bay in the 1930s and named the streets in the area after his ancestral home in Guangdong.

properties.title: Surrey Lane 舒梨道
properties.description: Named after Surrey, a county in England.

properties.title: Swatow Street 汕頭街
properties.description: Named after Shantou, a city in Guangdong, China. In the 19th century, Wan Chai was a key hub for sea trade and business. Trading companies established offices, docks, and warehouses along the coast. A British merchant firm, named their docks after Chinese ports: Xiamen and Shantou. These docks later moved inland and were renamed Amoy Street and Swatow Street. These were among Hong Kong's first streets named after Mainland Chinese cities.

properties.title: Sze Chuen Street 四川街
properties.description: Named after Sichuan, a province in China.

properties.title: Tai Nan Street 大南街
properties.description: Named after the port city of Danang in Vietnam. The street was probably located near a pier where people used to travel to Danang.

properties.title: Tai Nan West Street 大南西街
properties.description: Named after the port city of Danang in Vietnam. The street was probably located near a pier where people used to travel to Danang.

properties.title: Tai Yuen Street 太原街
properties.description: Named after Taiyuan, a city in Guangdong, China. Renamed from 'Albany Street' in 1909.

properties.title: Taku Street 大沽街
properties.description: Named after Taku Forts in Tianjin, China. The Taku Forts were built during the Ming Dynasty in China to protect against sea raiders. The Taku Forts were strengthened after the First Opium War in 1851. They were captured by the British and French during the Second Opium War.

properties.title: Tan Shan River 丹山河
properties.description: Named after River Jhleum, a river in Asia.

properties.title: Tonkin Street 東京街
properties.description: Named after Tonkin, a historical county in Vietnam.

properties.title: Tonkin Street West 東京街西
properties.description: Named after Tonkin, a historical county in Vietnam.

properties.title: Tsing Chau Street 青州街
properties.description: Named after the Green Island Cement Company, which operated in the early 1920s. The company was named after Ilha Verde, a former island in Macau, China, from which it originated.

properties.title: Tung Chau Street 通州街
properties.description: Named after Tongzhou, a district in Nantong, China.

properties.title: Tung Kun Street 東莞街
properties.description: Named after Dongguan, a city in Guangdong, China.

properties.title: Tung Sing Road 東勝道
properties.description: Named after Dongsheng, a district in Ordos City in Inner Mongolia, China

properties.title: Tweed Road 陶域道
properties.description: Named after Tweed, a river in Scotland.

properties.title: Ventura Avenue 溫黛娜徑
properties.description: Named after Ventura, a city in California, USA. Part of the Royal Palms development.

properties.title: Vimy Ridge
properties.description: Named after The Battle of Vimy Ridge, a significant part of the Battle of Arras during  WWI.

properties.title: Warwick Road 和域道
properties.description: Named after Warwick, a town in England.

properties.title: Waterloo Road 窩打老道
properties.description: Named after the Battle of Waterloo, which took place near Waterloo (at that time in the United Kingdom of the Netherlands, now in Belgium).

properties.title: Watford Road 和福道
properties.description: Named after Watford, a town in Herefordshire, England.

properties.title: Whampoa Street 黃埔街
properties.description: Named after Pazhou (formerly known as Whampoa Island), which was the chief anchorage for ships participating in Guangzhou's foreign trade. Traders rented storage for ship supplies and repair shops on Whampoa Island. The Hong Kong and Whampoa Dock Company, which played a critical role in the development of Hong Kong's dockyard industry and the Hung Hom area, owned a dockyard there.

properties.title: Wiltshire Road 渭州道
properties.description: Named after Wiltshire, a county in England.

properties.title: Wiltshire Road 偉順路
properties.description: Named after Wiltshire, a county in England.

properties.title: Woolwich Road 和域道
properties.description: Named after Woolwich, a district in southeast London, England.

properties.title: Woosung Street 吳松街
properties.description: Named after Wusong, a district in Shanghai, China. Renamed from 'Kennedy Street' in 1909.

properties.title: Wuhu Street 蕪湖街
properties.description: Named after Wuhu, a city in Anhui, China. Renamed from 'Market Street' in 1909.

properties.title: Wu Nam Street 湖南街
properties.description: Named after Hunan, a province in China.

properties.title: Wu Pak Street 湖北街
properties.description: Named after Hubei, a province in China.

properties.title: Yen Chow Street 欽州街
properties.description: Named after Qinzhou, a city in Guangxi, China.

properties.title: Yen Chow Street West 欽州街西
properties.description: Named after Qinzhou, a city in Guangxi, China.

properties.title: York Road 約道
properties.description: Named after York, a city in England.

properties.title: Yu Chau Street 汝州街
properties.description: Named after Ruzhou, a city in Henan, China.

properties.title: Yunnan Lane 雲南里
properties.description: Named after Yunnan, a province in China. Renamed from 'Seventh Lane' in 1909.

properties.title: Yun Ping Road 恩平道
properties.description: Named after Enping, one of the four counties in Guangdong. Lee Hysan, a businessman from Guangdong, developed Causeway Bay in the 1930s and named the streets in the area after his ancestral home in Guangdong.

properties.title: Zermatt Avenue 策馬特大道
properties.description: Named after Zermatt, a municipality in Switzerland. Part of the Valais development.

properties.title: Zurich Avenue 蘇黎世大道
properties.description: Named after Zurich, a city in Switzerland. Part of the Valais development.
